name: libmesh

conflicts.name: +metaphysicl
conflicts.description: libmesh: The interface to metaphysicl is not available in libMesh versions older than 1.3.0. Please explicitly disable this variant.

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: capnproto
variants.description: Compile with the bundled capnproto serialization library

variants.name: exodusii
variants.description: Compile with the bundled ExodusII output library

variants.name: vtk
variants.description: Compile with  VTK input/output library

variants.name: fparser
variants.description: Compile with the bundled fparser function parser library

variants.name: gmv
variants.description: Compile with the bundled gmv format IO library

variants.name: laspack
variants.description: Compile with the bundled laspack interative solver library

variants.name: libhilbert
variants.description: Compile with the bundled libHilbert partitioning library

variants.name: metaphysicl
variants.description: Compile with the bundled metaphysicl AD library

variants.name: perflog
variants.description: Compile with performance logging support

variants.name: blocked
variants.description: Compile with support for blocked storage

variants.name: metis
variants.description: Compile with the bundled METIS graph partitioning library

variants.name: nanoflann
variants.description: Compile with the bundled nanoflann graph library

variants.name: nemesis
variants.description: Compile with the bundled nemesis IO library

variants.name: netcdf
variants.description: Compile with the bundled NETCDF IO library

variants.name: qhull
variants.description: Compile with the bundled qhull mesh generation library

variants.name: sfc
variants.description: Compile with the bundled sfcurves partitioning library

variants.name: tetgen
variants.description: Compile with the bundled tetgen mesh generation library

variants.name: triangle
variants.description: Compile with the bundled Triangle mesh generation library

variants.name: boost
variants.description: Compile with components dependent on boost

variants.name: eigen
variants.description: support for dense linear algebra with Eigen

variants.name: hdf5
variants.description: Compile with support for HDF5 files

variants.name: slepc
variants.description: Compile with support for the SLEPc eigensolver

variants.name: petsc
variants.description: Compile with support for the PETSc

variants.name: debug
variants.description: Compile with support for debugging

variants.name: mpi
variants.description: Enables MPI parallelism

variants.name: threads
variants.description: Enable threading support (with a particular scheduler, in the case of openmp and tbb)

description:
The libMesh library provides a framework for the numerical simulation of
partial differential equations using arbitrary unstructured
discretizations on serial and parallel platforms.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: boost
dependencies.description:
Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries,
emphasizing libraries that work well with the C++ Standard Library.
Boost libraries are intended to be widely useful, and usable across a
broad spectrum of applications. The Boost license encourages both
commercial and non-commercial use.

dependencies.name: eigen
dependencies.description:
Eigen is a C++ template library for linear algebra matrices, vectors,
numerical solvers, and related algorithms.

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.

dependencies.name: perl
dependencies.description:
Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.

dependencies.name: petsc
dependencies.description:
PETSc is a suite of data structures and routines for the scalable
(parallel) solution of scientific applications modeled by partial
differential equations.

dependencies.name: slepc
dependencies.description: Scalable Library for Eigenvalue Problem Computations.

dependencies.name: tbb
dependencies.description:
This is an earlier version of Intel parallel software development tools
and has now been replaced by the Intel oneAPI Toolkits. LICENSE
INFORMATION: By downloading and using this software, you agree to the
terms and conditions of the software license agreements at
https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependencies.name: vtk
dependencies.description:
The Visualization Toolkit (VTK) is an open-source, freely available
software system for 3D computer graphics, image processing and
visualization.

dependent_to.name: amp
dependent_to.description:
The Advanced Multi-Physics (AMP) package. The Advanced Multi-Physics
(AMP) package is an open source parallel object-oriented computational
framework that is designed with single and multi-domain multi-physics
applications in mind.
